quest.name: Have a Heart
journal: Guthjon is still reeling from your miraculous find.
objectives: Deliver the chunk of leonine to Urianger.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I had hoped we would find leonine, but to find that particular specimen is nothing short of a miracle.

dialogue.name: GUTHJON
dialogue.text: I wouldn't believe it had I not seen it for myself.

dialogue.name: GUTHJON
dialogue.text: Before you set it in the Talos, would you take it to Magnus?

dialogue.name: GUTHJON
dialogue.text: For three long years he's believed she died for nothing. He must know the truth─that her sacrifice was not in vain.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We'll take it straight to him. You have my word. Thank you, Guthjon, for all your help.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Right, then. Let's not keep everyone waiting.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Gods. What do we say?

dialogue.name: GUTHJON
dialogue.text: I can only imagine the look on his face when he sees that.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: ...What? Oh, it's you.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: If you've come to complain about the trolley, you'll find no sympathy from me. I told you before it won't run, and you wouldn't listen.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Oh, but it will. Now that we have this.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Your name is engraved on it, along with your son's. It was a gift from your wife, Magnus. From Agna.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: No... No, she couldn't have...

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Agna...

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Take it. Do with it what you will.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Are you certain? It would delay our plans, but─

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: I said take it. It was you who found it, you who needs it.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Looking at that stone, all I can see is...is...

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Please, just leave me be.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I hope you'll be there when the Talos stirs to life.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'm sure she'd want you to see it.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Would you do the honors of delivering this to Urianger?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Finally we can move on to Nabaath Areng. Assuming this works, of course.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Sorry I couldn't be of more help. By the sounds of it, you have a knack for handling strange requests.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: On the bright side, Urianger taught me a lot about the Talos and their hearts. I think I can help if they need further repairs.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: You what!? By the gods, I didn't think it possible.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: You found leonine? Truly? Then what are we waiting for─let's get that trolley moving!

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Hmmm...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thou art returned, and with leonine it would seem.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: As promised, the Talos hath been made ready to receive its heart, thanks in no small part to Jeryk, Thaffe, and Minfilia.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: At last we shall return time to the timeless, this sentinel of stone, that we may press on towards Nabaath Areng.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Very good. Now, let us begin.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I only want what's best for her. If only she could see that...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: <sniff> I'm fine. Really. It's just been a long day.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: I must confess you've impressed me. I did not expect the Talos to be in such fine condition.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: You've done us a kindness far greater than anything we deserve. Thank you. Thank you so much.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Just thinking about the trolley running down the tracks, gears churning─gods, I can't stop smiling!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Mine apologies for the delay. Minfilia and I had a private matter to discuss.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Which bringeth me to the question─how didst thou find Thancred during your search?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: He spoke of Minfilia? Of his own accord? I see...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis well that he did, and with such candor.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I attempted to broach the subject before. Mine intention was to ensure no words remained unspoken between them, lest tragedy intercede. A regret I myself know all too well. Alas, in the end he refused to heed my counsel.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: A time will come when they must face the reality of their circumstances. But I have faith that all will be well in time...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Now, let us not tarry any longer. The Talos and Nabaath Areng await.
